channel.title: daap on Shantanu Vs The World
channel.description: Recent content in daap on Shantanu Vs The World

item.title: SSH Tunneling On Android
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: If you want to have a secure browsing environment or just want to access your home network securely without exposing extra services to the internet and without the mess that comes with setting up and maintaining a VPN server, ssh tunneling is your rescuer. In this post, I'll tell you how to setup an ssh tunnel to your home network easily. Also look for some bonus tips at the end ;)

item.title: Firefly / sqlite error "unable to open database file" Solution
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Recently I came across a weird error while trying to run firefly itunes server (mt-daapd) on my router (Asus wl-500w). It had something to do with sqlite and gave a vague message “Unable to open database file”. After going bonkers for a short time, I solved it and this is how. One of my hard disks crashed recently and unfortunately it was the one I had connected to my router to serve media to me all over the house (through PS3/laptop) or when I travel (through laptop/phone).

item.title: Compiling Latest FireFly (mt-daapd) for ASUS WL-500W
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: FireFly is a nice DAAP based media server that allows you to listen to your music collection anywhere using any DAAP based client like iTunes, with other players (like Winamp, Rhythmbox, VLC, etc) using plugins, or it even has its own dedicated php/flash/java based clients that can be fired up on any platform any computer giving you instant nirvana. Many people, like me, use it on their Routers or NAS boxes to access their music anywhere without having to keep their home PC running or lugging around external drives.
